active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the pros and cons of using SoapUI versus OWASP ZAP for testing SOAP-specific vulnerabilities like XML injection. Reference the OWASP API Top 10 and real-world breach examples (e.g., API traffic powering 83% of web traffic per Akamai). Justify your position with tool features and prior knowledge of web proxies like Burp Suite.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing Tools. Topic: SOAP 014_API Testing Tools (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Penetration Testing Tools > 004_Web Application Testing Tools > 014_API Testing Tools > SOAP 014_API Testing Tools). Voter consensus: 70% approval, prioritize completeness (SoapUI/ReadyAPI full features, Burp/ZAP for SOAP), pedagogy (Bloom's progression, 4-layer scaffolding), security vulns (XML injection, WSDL enum, OWASP API Top 10), prior knowledge (web tools), big picture (APIs 83% traffic, breach prevention). Incorporate these EXACT learning objectives, active learning, scaffolding layers, and flashcard schema. Research context: API/SOAP defs from OWASP/soapui.org; tools for pen testing SOAP (structure: envelope/header/body; vulns: XXE/auth; tools: SoapUI security tests, Burp/ZAP API support). Generate flashcards ONLY in this JSON format per card: {'front': 'Question', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '... (ref Bloom/layer)', 'references': '...', 'related_activity': '...'}}. Use schema: mix types, distractors per protocol. Cover all layers/objectives comprehensively, security-focused for pen testing. Output 50 cards as a JSON array.
